title: Richard Markes
text:
Richard Markes (1671–1704) was a <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament">M.P.</a> for <a href="Petersfield%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Petersfield</a>.
He was born in <a href="Portsmouth">Portsmouth</a>, the only son of Richard and Anne Markes. In 1693 he married Mary Randall of Petersfield: they had 3 sons and 2 daughters. He was Clerk of the Rope Yard in <a href="Portsmouth%20Dockyard">Portsmouth Dockyard</a> from 1691; and a <a href="Freedom%20of%20the%20City">Freeman</a> of <a href="Portsmouth">Portsmouth</a> from 1702.
